definitions.definition: Attestation of a fact or event; testimony.
definitions.example: She can bear witness, since she was there at the time.

definitions.definition: One who sees or has personal knowledge of something.
definitions.example: As a witness to the event, I can confirm that he really said that.

definitions.definition: Someone called to give evidence in a court.
definitions.example: The witness for the prosecution did not seem very credible.

definitions.definition: One who is called upon to witness an event or action, such as a wedding or the signing of a document.
definitions.example: The bridesmaid and best man at a wedding typically serve as the witnesses.

definitions.definition: Something that serves as evidence; a sign or token.
To furnish proof of, to show.
definitions.example: 1667: round he throws his baleful eyes / That witness'd huge affliction and dismay — John Milton, Paradise Lost, Book 1 ll. 56-7

definitions.definition: To see or gain knowledge of through experience.
(construed with to or for) To present personal religious testimony; to preach at (someone) or on behalf of.
To see the execution of (a legal instrument), and subscribe it for the purpose of establishing its authenticity.
definitions.example: to witness a bond or a deed
